result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori Jean Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lori Jean Cox is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lori Jean Cox was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs accordingly to a schedule as set forth of Probation & Parole.

Provide a DNA sample.  
Comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: Serve 60 days in the Pepin County Jail with huber privileges for employment, community service, volunteer opportunity, assessment or treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lori Jean Cox

records.addlTxt:
Discharge Certificate.   Effective 9/12/19, discharged absolutely.
Civil rights restored:  1)Right to Vote.  2)Obligations for jury duty.
Civil rights not restored:  1)Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is received from the governer.  2)Public office can not be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.
From DOC that defendant paid all court ordered obligations, request to remove hearing.

Letter from B.B. of St. Vincent De Paul.

Defendant Lori Jean Cox in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentenced to 4 yrs. WI State prison, 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES stayed and placed on 3 yrs probation with conditions; advised of felony prohibitions.
Hand delivered by DOC
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
To Signature Bond

ADDRESS INFO for Lori Jean Cox
Current: 657 Oak Street, Mondovi, WI 54755 United States  (Effective: 05-17-2016)
Prior: 175 Country Lane #8, Durand, WI 54736

Back on record @ 3:17 p.m.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 2.  Plea Colloquy. Court advises defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty, dismiss counts 1 & 3, Order PSI.  Atty Randtke addresses bond.  State has no objection to modify to signature.  Defendant addressed the Court.  Court modifies bond to $2500 Signature Bond with conditions:  comply with random drug testing and pay the costs of the testing; consent to search your residence, person or vehicle; comply with your treatment program.

Defendant Lori Jean Cox in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Lori Jean Cox in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms counsel received the Information; advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties and constitutional rights.  NGP's all counts.  Parties reached an agreement, need time to complete paperwork.  Off the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lori Jean Cox in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Lori Jean Cox in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg., WOPH form filed with the Court.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA files Information.
C.E. is required to appear on 05/17/2016 at 2:45 pm
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lori Jean Cox in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Lori Jean Cox in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk.  Bond continued.

Defendant Lori Jean Cox in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State reviews charges and max penalties. Courts advises defendant of rights including the right to a preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody and 20 days if not. State requests a cash bond in the amount of $2,500.00. Defendant addresses bond. Courts sets cash bond in the amount of $2,500.00. Defendant to contact SPD office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
